def: The state or quality of being inexhaustible; abundance.
Pertaining to, or resembling, an excrescence. [R.] Hawthorne.
Destitute of water; as, anhydrous salts or acids.
A truss, framed with a king-post; -- used in roofs, bridges,etc.
A suborder of Crinoidea found chiefly in the Paleozoic rocks.
An argument, or apparent argument, which professes to bedecisive of the matter at issue, while in reality it is not; asophism.
The branch of science which treats of the nervous system.

Having half of the similar parts of a crystals, instead of all;consisting of half the planes which full symmetry would require, aswhen a cube has planes only on half of its eight solid angles, or oneplane out of a pair on each of its edges; or as in the case of atetrahedron, which is hemihedral to an octahedron, it being containedunder four of the planes of an octahedron.-- Hem`i*he"dral*ly, adv.
Having half the nature of another. [R.] Shak.
Of or pertaining to Livonia, a district of Russia near theBaltic Sea.
